actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-557, by Mr. Hall (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 1306. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as waived when called up for consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 141.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

At the conclusion of debate, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution. By voice vote, the Chair announced that the Noes had prevailed and subsequently, an objection to the voice vote based on the absence of a quorum was lodged. The Chair at that point postponed further proceedings on the question until Wednesday, July 1. The point of order was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 266 - 138 (Roll No. 252).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (S. 1306) to amend title V of the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend certain programs, and for other purposes, and against the consideration of such conference report.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on S. 1306 (substance abuse and mental health programs). Considers the report read when called up.

titles.title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (S. 1306) to amend title V of the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend certain programs, and for other purposes, and against the consideration of such conference report.
